intro: Scrophularia fruticosa, commonly known as common figwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features opposite, oval-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces spikes of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks. Scrophularia fruticosa is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
